com.adidas.ui.widget

Class FontWidgetCommonLogic

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.adidas.ui.widget.FontWidgetCommonLogic

  • public class FontWidgetCommonLogic
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for manipulation with typefaces for TextViews.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  FontWidgetCommonLogic.TypefaceWithFakeBoldSupport
      Object used to return a TypeFace with a flag to identify if we should apply the fake bold.

    • Method Detail

      • setFont

        public static void setFont(android.content.Context ctx,
                           android.util.AttributeSet attrs,
                           android.widget.TextView element)
        Use this method to set a custom font in your code (/assets/fonts/) If the attr adiFontFamily is set to "adineue" the font used to print the text will be adineue bold. If it is "bradley" then it will be bradley. We combine values from android:textAppearence attribute set for this component and together values defined on component itself. Any attribute defined on component itself will override value from anroid:textAppearence attribute.
        Parameters:
        ctx -
        attrs - The attributes for the TextView
        element - The element to apply the font change

      • setFont

        public static void setFont(android.content.Context ctx,
                           android.util.AttributeSet attrs,
                           int defStyleAttr,
                           android.widget.TextView element)
        Use this method to set a custom font in your code (/assets/fonts/) If the attr adiFontFamily is set to "adineue" the font used to print the text will be adineue bold. If it is "bradley" then it will be bradley. We combine values from android:textAppearence attribute set for this component and together values defined on component itself. Any attribute defined on component itself will override value from anroid:textAppearence attribute.
        Parameters:
        ctx -
        attrs - The attributes for the TextView
        defStyleAttr - An attribute in the current theme that contains a reference to a style resource that supplies defaults values for the StyledAttributes. Can be 0 to not look for defaults. See Resources.Theme class and its method obtainStyledAttributes for more details.
        element - The element to apply the font change

      • setFont

        public static void setFont(android.content.Context ctx,
                           android.util.AttributeSet attrs,
                           int defStyleAttr,
                           int defStyleRes,
                           android.widget.TextView element)
        Use this method to set a custom font in your code (/assets/fonts/) If the attr adiFontFamily is set to "adineue" the font used to print the text will be adineue bold. If it is "bradley" then it will be bradley. We combine values from android:textAppearence attribute set for this component and together values defined on component itself. Any attribute defined on component itself will override value from anroid:textAppearence attribute.
        Parameters:
        ctx -
        attrs - The attributes for the TextView
        defStyleAttr - An attribute in the current theme that contains a reference to a style resource that supplies defaults values for the StyledAttributes. Can be 0 to not look for defaults. See Resources.Theme class and its method obtainStyledAttributes for more details.
        defStyleAttr - TA resource identifier of a style resource that supplies default values for the StyledAttributes, used only if defStyleAttr is 0 or can not be found in the theme. Can be 0 to not look for defaults. See Resources.Theme class and its method obtainStyledAttributes for more details.
        element - The element to apply the font change

      • getTypeface

        public static android.graphics.Typeface getTypeface(android.content.Context theContext,
                                                    java.lang.String fontFamily,
                                                    int textStyle)
        Method to retrieve the Typeface that corresponds to a font family and to a text style.
        Parameters:
        theContext - The context to load the strings and the font face
        fontFamily - String with the font family to load
        textStyle - Integer containing the TextStyle, take a look to Typeface to show the available text styles.
        Returns:
        FontWidgetCommonLogic.TypefaceWithFakeBoldSupport

      • applyFont

        public static void applyFont(android.content.Context ctx,
                             java.lang.String fontFamily,
                             int textStyle,
                             android.widget.TextView element)
        Apply font family and text style to the text element.
        Parameters:
        ctx - context
        fontFamily - font family name from resources
        textStyle - Typeface style
        element - text view
